intro: Pterisanthes parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved pterisanthes, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
